title: CLARITY Data Package Resource Specification
description: CLARITY Data Package is a simple specification for data access and delivery.

data.title: Data
data.context: Within the context of CLARITY Data Packages, this property is not used.

resourcePath.title: Path
resourcePath.description: A reference to the data for this resource, as either a path as a string, or an array of paths as strings. of valid URIs.
resourcePath.context:
The dereferenced value of each referenced data source in `path` `MUST` be commensurate with a native, dereferenced representation of the data the resource describes. For example, in a *Tabular* Data Resource, this means that the dereferenced value of `path` `MUST` be an array.

SECURITY: / (absolute path) and ../ (relative parent path) are forbidden to avoid security vulnerabilities when implementing data package software. These limitations on resource path ensure that resource paths only point to files within the data package directory and its subdirectories. This prevents data package software being exploited by a malicious user to gain unintended access to sensitive information.

*Data in Multiple Files:*
Usually, a resource will have only a single file associated to it. However, sometimes it may be convenient to have a single resource whose data is split across multiple files -- perhaps the data is large and having it in one file would be inconvenient. To support this use case the path property MAY be an array of strings rather than a single string: "path": ["myfile1.csv", "myfile2.csv"]. It is NOT permitted to mix fully qualified URLs and relative paths in a path array: strings MUST either all be relative paths or all URLs.

*CLARITY Best Practice (proposal):* dataset resources MUST be located in a "data" folder in the root of the in a Data Package (where the json descriptor is also located) in order to have a better organization of the contents. Within the data folder, datasets MAY be further organized creating additional subfolders if necessary.

format.title: Format
format.description: The file format of this resource.

mediatype.title: Media Type
mediatype.description: The media type of this resource. Can be any valid media type listed with [IANA](https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml).

encoding.title: Encoding
encoding.description: The file encoding of this resource.

bytes.title: Bytes
bytes.description: The size of this resource in bytes.
bytes.context: This parameter is helpful for determining how to process the data package, thus for instance, if we know in advance that several of the resources are large, we can determine that it is better to process the contents in a batch process and later on inform the user when the results are ready.

hash.title: Hash
hash.description: The MD5 hash of this resource. Indicate other hashing algorithms with the {algorithm}:{hash} format.

relation.title: Relation
relation.description: If present, it is used to indicate that upper and lower represent percentages of other values (e.g. `increase-in-baseline`)

resource.title: Data Resource

crs.context: In CLARITY, default crs is epsg:3035

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An `array` of tag values referring to the resource

resource.context:
According to the Data Resource specification: "A resource MUST contain a property describing the location of the data associated to the resource. The location of resource data MUST be specified by the presence of one (and only one) of these two properties:

# path: for data in files located online or locally on disk.
# data: for data inline in the descriptor itself."

CLARITY Data Packages ONLY support resources that describe their location with the `path` property. This is to avoid having Data Package descriptors (.json) files bloated with thousands of text lines encoding the data which would make the descriptor unmanageable and unreadable. Instead of that, CLARITY Data Packages forces to store that data in a file and reference it within the Data Package itself or to a remote location.

resources.title: Data Resources
resources.description: An `array` of Data Resource objects, each compliant with the [Data Resource](/data-resource/) specification.
